business.headline: Sensex, Nifty trade flat after 2-day tariff relief rally; Gensol shares tumble 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 84.98 points to 76,649.91 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.25 points to trade at 23,302.30. However, broader market indices did not see any major dip, and it is likely to provide relief to retail investors.
Gensol Engineering shares in focus today as Sebi takes action against promotersGensol Engineering shares have plunged 83% this year, and the market regulator's interim order may deepen the sell-off.

Sebi vs Jaggi brothers: What's in the interim order over wrongdoings?During its probe, the market regulator found 'blatant violation of rules of corporate governance' and 'alleged wrongdoings'.  It said that the promoters were running Gensol like a private firm.

Sebi bans Gensol's Jaggi brothers for diverting company funds for personal useSebi has passed an interim order barring promoters Anmol Singh Jaggi and Puneet Singh Jaggi from taking part in the securities market and from holding any position as directors or key managerial personnel in any listed company.

Government, Swiggy join hands to boost jobs in gig, delivery sectorThe government said the partnership with Swiggy would help take the National Career Service portal deeper into the gig economy space.

How Niu Gensheng, China's dairy tycoon, rose from poverty to prosperityNiu Gensheng was born into a poor family in Inner Mongolia. His parents couldn't afford to raise him, so they sold him to a cattle farmer. The farmer adopted him, but life was still full of challenges.

Retail inflation eases further to 3.34% in March, lowest since August 2019The March CPI inflation print came in below February's 3.61%, marking the second straight month that inflation has stayed under the Reserve Bank of India's 4% medium-term target.

Hermes overtakes LVMH in market value years after takeover dramaWay back in 2010, LVMH's billionaire CEO Bernard Arnault shocked the corporate world by acquiring a huge stake in Hermes. It was seen as an effort to seize control of the company. But the Hermes family fought back. They came together to defend their brand and ultimately made Arnault sell his shares.

Sensex gains nearly 1,600 points, Nifty above 23,300; IndusInd bank gains 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 1,577.63 points to close at 76,734.89, while the NSE Nifty50 added 500 points to end at 23,328.55.

Dalal Street dusts off Trump's April 2 tariff shock, stages full comebackTrading resumed after a long weekend, but there was no slowdown in terms of momentum. The Nifty50 climbed as much as 2.4% intraday, comfortably reclaiming its pre-tariff territory, while the Sensex gained over 1,600 points.

UPS vs NPS: Which pension scheme should you opt forThe Unified Pension Scheme is the new retirement scheme effective from April 1, 2025. It is for central government employees. If you're currently under NPS, you'll have the option to shift to this new plan.

This multibagger stock has given 13,000% return. Should you buy?Since its stock market debut on July 28, 2003, the company has delivered a return of nearly 12,951.78%. It touched its 52-week high of Rs 2,559.95 on September 4, 2024.

entertainment.headline: Aamir Ali opens up about being sexually harassed at 14: Stopped taking trainsActor Aamir Ali has revealed a distressing experience from his teenage years when he faced sexual harassment. He recollected he was 14 when he was touched inappropriately.

Alex O'Nell on Phule controversy: Watch it and have a conversation | ExclusiveActor Alex O'Nell discusses the controversy surrounding the film 'Phule', which is a biopic about social reformers Jyotirao and Savitribai Phule, amidst objections from certain organisations.

Jaideep, Saif and others grooving to Jewel Thief song Jaadu is pure vibe. VideoThe Netflix heist-thriller 'Jewel Thief' is set to premiere on April 25. Ahead of its release, Nikita Dutta and Kunal Kapoor shared a fun behind-the-scenes clip from the promotions, where the cast is seen enjoying a light-hearted moment while grooving to the song 'Jaadu'.

Malayalam actor claims co-star insisted on fixing her dress on set: He was on drugsMalayalam actor Vincy Aloshious revealed that her co-star, allegedly under the influence of drugs, insisted on fixing her dress. However, she did not name the person.

Emotional Rekha Gupta on Akshay Kumar's Kesari 2: Want to give more for motherlandDelhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was emotional after watching Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' at a special screening. Addressing the media, she said that the film was goosebumps-inducing.

Who is Cody John? Meet Emma Roberts' low-key actor fiancéEmma Roberts is engaged to actor Cody John, confirming the news on Instagram. The couple, together since 2022, keeps their relationship low-key, despite growing public interest in their romantic journey.
Ibrahim Ali Khan responds to dating rumours with Palak TiwariIbrahim Ali Khan has responded to rumours about his relationship with Palak Tiwari, describing her as a 'good friend'.

Home Alone 2 director Chris Columbus calls Donald Trump cameo a 'curse'Director Chris Columbus reveals his regret over Donald Trump's cameo in 'Home Alone 2'. He describes it as a 'curse' and an 'albatross' on the film.
BTS member Jin announces second solo album EchoBTS' Jin is set to make a comeback with his second solo album 'Echo', releasing this May. Fans anticipate this as a step towards a BTS group reunion.

Anthony Mackie says Avengers Doomsday will bring back 'old Marvel feeling'In an exciting development for Marvel fans, Anthony Mackie promises a return to classic Marvel vibes with 'Avengers: Doomsday'. Directed by the Russo Brothers, the film is set for a May 2026 release.

Nani reacts to HIT 3 being compared with Animal, Marco, and KillAt the trailer launch of HIT: The Third Case, Nani addressed fan comparisons between HIT 3, Animal, Marco, and Kill, stating that HIT 3 follows its own cinematic language and grammar.

Kalki's Nag Ashwin says he wrote Inception-like story before Christopher Nolan'Kalki 2898 AD' director Nag Ashwin recently opened up about his early writing experiences, revealing that his story was similar to the Hollywood film Inception, and sharing his admiration for Trivikram's 2010 film Khaleja.

Cate Blanchett on her Hollywood retirement: I am serious about giving up actingCate Blanchett, known for her versatility, revealed her serious intent to retire from acting. The acclaimed actor said that she wished to explore other interests beyond the film industry.

Salman Khan doesn't look it, but he is a Devmanus: Mahesh ManjrekarMahesh Manjrekar praises his unique bond with Salman Khan, describing him as a 'Devmanus' despite not fitting the conventional image. He will next be seen in the Marathi film 'Devmanus'.

Sunny Deol's Jaat sparks outrage over church scene, Christians demand banThe release of Sunny Deol's latest film 'Jaat' has ignited controversy due to a scene perceived as disrespectful by the Christian community. The community has demanded a ban and legal action, claiming the portrayal is an insult to their faith.

AR Rahman reacts to Abhijeet Bhattacharya slamming him for 'overusing' technologySinger Abhijeet Bhattacharya criticised AR Rahman for overusing technology in music, impacting live instrumentation. AR Rahman defended himself in an exclusive interview, highlighting his support for musicians.

The Last of Us Season 2: Who Is Eugene and Why His Death MattersThe Last of Us Season 2 introduces Eugene, a mysterious off-screen character whose death—linked to Joel—adds emotional depth and unanswered questions. Though absent in life, Eugene's story unfolds through flashbacks and dialogue, setting up a powerful turning point in the HBO series.

Ibrahim Ali Khan finally addresses Nadaaniyan criticism: They tried to twist itIbrahim Ali Khan breaks his silence over criticism of his debut film 'Nadaaniyan'. The actor admitted that he needs to work on his craft, but maintained that social media was harsher than it should have been while reviewing the film.

Premalu actor Naslen reveals why he rejected to Ajith Kumar's Good Bad UglyDuring a recent press meet for the film 'Alappuzha Gymkhana', Malayalam actor Naslen Gafoor revealed why he turned down a role in Ajith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly'. Naslen is best known for the blockbuster Premalu (2024).

general news.headline: Waqf Amendment Act legal battle begins, Supreme Court to hear 73 petitions todayThe Supreme Court will on Wednesday hear 73 petitions challenging the constitutional validity of the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, on grounds ranging from alleged religious discrimination and executive overreach to dilution of Waqf protections.

Amid Trump's tariff war, China issues over 8,500 visas to 'Indian friends'China has issued over 85,000 visas to Indian citizens in 2025, significantly up from last year, amidst growing diplomatic tensions with the US over trade tariffs.

Air hostess on ventilator sexually assaulted by hospital staff in Gurugram: CopsThe case came to light after the 46-year-old air hostess registered a complaint alleging that she was sexually assaulted by hospital staff while unconscious and on a ventilator.

Malayalam actor claims co-star insisted on fixing her dress on set: He was on drugsMalayalam actor Vincy Aloshious revealed that her co-star, allegedly under the influence of drugs, insisted on fixing her dress. However, she did not name the person.

Madam will get AC removed now, modern cooling: Cow dung payback for DU principalA viral video showed the Delhi University Students' Union president smearing cow dung on the walls of Lakshmibai College Principal Pratyush Vatsala's office, days after the latter was seen doing the same in a classroom to "beat the heat".

2 Telangana men killed in Dubai bakery attack by Pakistani nationalExpressing grief, Union Minister of State for Home Bandi Sanjay Kumar said he had spoken to MEA officials and that Union home ministry officials were in touch with them.

Indian-origin CEO caught in elite brothel scandal in USAnurag Bajpayee, an Indian-origin CEO in the US, was one of several high-profile men who shared documents, IDs and references to become part of an elite Cambridge brothel, according to the Wall Street Journal. The Lucknow-born Bajpayee's firm has backed him in the case. The brothel promised "girlfriend experience".

Sebi bans Gensol's Jaggi brothers for diverting company funds for personal useSebi has passed an interim order barring promoters Anmol Singh Jaggi and Puneet Singh Jaggi from taking part in the securities market and from holding any position as directors or key managerial personnel in any listed company.
Maach, mishti, and more: Why fish is not just food for Bengalis, it is sacredFish market by a Kali temple, sacred or sacrilege?

26/11 turning point in India-Pak ties: S Jaishankar says Pak stuck in bad habitsOn November 26, 2008, a group of 10 Pakistani terrorists launched attacks at multiple locations in Mumbai, killing 166 persons in the nearly 60-hour siege.

US judge blasts Trump admin in wrongful deportation case, asks officials to testifyA US judge slammed the Trump administration for failing to help wrongly deported Kilmar Abrego Garcia return from El Salvador, saying "nothing has been done." She ordered officials to submit docs and testify under oath by April 23.

Ajinkya Rahane's quip to Shreyas Iyer after KKR's loss to PBKS goes viralAjinkya Rahane didn't hold back in his post-match chat with Shreyas Iyer. Speaking in Marathi, the KKR skipper gave a candid breakdown of the defeat—one that saw PBKS script a dramatic comeback and defend just 111 runs.

Alex O'Nell on Phule controversy: Watch it and have a conversation | ExclusiveActor Alex O'Nell discusses the controversy surrounding the film 'Phule', which is a biopic about social reformers Jyotirao and Savitribai Phule, amidst objections from certain organisations.

Leave US and get cash, plane tickets? Trump's proposed plan for immigrantsDonald Trump floated a plan where the US would offer money and plane tickets to undocumented immigrants who choose to leave the US on their own.

TikTok videos drove me to Ukraine war, claims Chinese soldier fighting for RussiaA Chinese man named Wang Guangjun joined the war in Ukraine after watching TikTok videos that made Russian soldiers look cool. He was promised an easy job and good pay, but ended up fighting on the front lines. He was later caught by Ukrainian troops.

Man killed by YouTuber wife, her lover over affair, body dumped in drainA woman, who is a YouTuber, was arrested on charges of killing her husband after he came to know about her affair with a man, who is also a YouTuber in Haryana's Bhiwani. The accused dumped the victim's body in a drain.

Jaideep, Saif and others grooving to Jewel Thief song Jaadu is pure vibe. VideoThe Netflix heist-thriller 'Jewel Thief' is set to premiere on April 25. Ahead of its release, Nikita Dutta and Kunal Kapoor shared a fun behind-the-scenes clip from the promotions, where the cast is seen enjoying a light-hearted moment while grooving to the song 'Jaadu'.

In Bengal poll marathon, how Mamata plans to blow the whistle on fake votersThe Trinamool's counteroffensive on alleged bungling in electoral rolls will see trained party workers go door to door to update voter data on a revamped app

Trump takes aim at Harvard again, says it should lose tax-exempt statusAs his administration froze approximately USD 2.3 billion in federal funding to Harvard, President Donald Trump has now threatened to tax the university as a "political entity".

Biden slams Trump in 1st post-presidency speech; White House takes bedtime jibeIn his first major speech since leaving the Oval Office, Joe Biden blasted the Trump administration for slashing Social Security staff, closing offices, and risking benefit delays.

Historic IPL debut on cards? What's Rajasthan's plan for Vaibhav SuryavanshiA historic IPL debut is knocking on the doors for Vaibhav Suryavanshi as he continues to impress within the Rajasthan Royals camp. Will RR take the punt and put the 13-year-old into the mix?
Ward boy posts reels of him treating patients, removed from dutyA ward boy at a hospital in Rajasthan's Alwar was seen treating patients in viral reels, leading to his removal from duty.

Faridabad man beaten up by girlfriend, her family after refusing to leave wifeA married man in Faridabad was seriously injured after allegedly being assaulted by his girlfriend and her family for refusing to leave his wife and children to marry her.

LA 2028 Olympics: South California city of Pomona to host cricketThe City of Pomona on the West Coast of the United States will host cricket during the Los Angeles Olympics. The LA28 Olympic Games will feature men's and women's cricket.

sports.headline: Rahane admits 'collective failure' after KKR fail to chase 112 vs PBKSKolkata Knight Riders captain Ajinkya Rahane described his team's 16-run loss against Punjab Kings as a "collective batting failure" after a spectacular collapse on Tuesday.

LA 2028 Olympics: South California city of Pomona to host cricketThe City of Pomona on the West Coast of the United States will host cricket during the Los Angeles Olympics. The LA28 Olympic Games will feature men's and women's cricket.

Commentary icon Alan Wilkins set to join IPL 2025 after beating cancerAlan Wilkins announced himself ready to return to the commentary box for IPL 2025 after beating throat cancer. The 71-year-old veteran, known for his iconic voice, called this comeback a fresh lease on life and urged fans: "Never give up."

Moving Shreyas Iyer from No.3 for Maxwell? Ricky Ponting has hilarious responsePBKS coach Ricky Ponting made a hilarious remark when asked if he would consider moving Shreyas Iyer from number three in favour of Marcus Stoinis. Shreyas has been in fine form for PBKS at the No.3 spot.

NBA Play-in tournament: Magic edge past Hawks 120-95 to clinch Playoff Spot; Trae Young ejectedThe Orlando Magic edged out the Atlanta Hawks in a 7-vs-8 Play-In Tournament matchup on Tuesday, April 15, winning 120-95 at the Kia Centre.

KKR batted themselves into a hole: Mark Boucher's honest assessment of collapseFormer South Africa cricketer Mark Boucher said that the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) batted themselves into a hole following their 16-run loss against the Punjab Kings (PBKS) on Match 31 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

How Ricky Ponting and Shreyas Iyer inspired Mullanpur miracle? Nehal Wadhera revealsPunjab Kings (PBKS) batter Nehal Wadhera revealed how head coach Ricky Ponting and captain Shreyas Iyer inspired them to defend the lowest score in the IPL's history and register a 16-run victory over Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).

Ajinkya Rahane's quip to Shreyas Iyer after KKR's loss to PBKS goes viralAjinkya Rahane didn't hold back in his post-match chat with Shreyas Iyer. Speaking in Marathi, the KKR skipper gave a candid breakdown of the defeat—one that saw PBKS script a dramatic comeback and defend just 111 runs.

Historic IPL debut on cards? What's Rajasthan's plan for Vaibhav SuryavanshiA historic IPL debut is knocking on the doors for Vaibhav Suryavanshi as he continues to impress within the Rajasthan Royals camp. Will RR take the punt and put the 13-year-old into the mix?

PBKS vs KKR: Emotional Ricky Ponting reveals how Yuzi Chahal overcame injury scareAn emotional Ricky Ponting revealed how Yuzvendra Chahal overcame an injury scare to become PBKS' hero against KKR on Tuesday, April 15. Chahal was the star of the show as Punjab defended the lowest-ever target in IPL history.

PBKS vs KKR: Preity Zinta elated, hugs Yuzi Chahal after Punjab's record winPunjab Kings (PBKS) owner Preity Zinta was seen hugging Yuzvendra Chahal following his match-winning performance against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in Match 31 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

How Ricky Ponting and Shreyas Iyer inspired Mullanpur miracle? Nehal Wadhera revealsPunjab Kings (PBKS) batter Nehal Wadhera revealed how head coach Ricky Ponting and captain Shreyas Iyer inspired them to defend the lowest score in the IPL's history and register a 16-run victory over Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).

PBKS vs KKR: Emotional Ricky Ponting reveals how Yuzi Chahal overcame injury scareAn emotional Ricky Ponting revealed how Yuzvendra Chahal overcame an injury scare to become PBKS' hero against KKR on Tuesday, April 15. Chahal was the star of the show as Punjab defended the lowest-ever target in IPL history.

PBKS vs KKR: Preity Zinta elated, hugs Yuzi Chahal after Punjab's record winPunjab Kings (PBKS) owner Preity Zinta was seen hugging Yuzvendra Chahal following his match-winning performance against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in Match 31 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
